H0.text: Glacier is the agent that deposits a moraine as sediment.

H1.text: Human-caused scarring is the sediment deposited by a moraine.

H2.text: River erosion is the process that deposits a moraine.

H3.text: Wind is the agent that deposits sediment to form a moraine.

A4.text: Moraine is any accumulation of unconsolidated debris that has been previously carried along by a glacier or ice sheet.

A5.text: Moraine may also form by the accumulation of sand and gravel deposits from glacial streams emanating from the ice margin.
